definitions.definition: Half-melted snow or ice , generally located on the ground.
examples: As the skiing season drew to an end, there was nothing but slush left on the piste .

definitions.definition: Flavored shaved ice served as a drink.
A soft mixture of grease and other materials, used for lubrication .
The refuse grease and fat collected in cooking, especially on shipboard.
A mixture of white lead and lime , used as a paint to prevent oxidation .
Unsolicited manuscripts, as in slush pile .

main_definition: Half-melted snow or ice , generally located on the ground.
secondary_definitions: Flavored shaved ice served as a drink.
A soft mixture of grease and other materials, used for lubrication .
The refuse grease and fat collected in cooking, especially on shipboard.

( publishing ) Unsolicited manuscripts, as in slush pile .
